heading: 1 Introduction
text: Theses GSD UPD department can address variety topics, can take many different forms, can developed using many different processes. expectations students advise quite bit narrower. purpose document clearly articulate expectations students can make informed choice whether appropriate thesis advisor, based goals thesis.

heading: 2 Topics
text: accept thesis students whose projects fall within scope one standing committee Transportation Research Board. can search standing committees (check box “Standing Committee” Committee Type heading).Standing committees scopes may particular interest UPD students :ACH10: Standing Committee PedestriansACH20: Standing Committee Bicycle TransportationAED10: Standing Committee Statewide/National Transportatoin Data Information SystemsAED20: Standing Committee Urban Transportation Data Information SystemsAED40: Standing Committee Geographic Information ScienceAED80: Standing Committee Visualization TransportationAEP10: Standing Committee Transportation Planning Policy ProcessesAEP30: Standing Committee Travel Behavior ValuesAEP70: Standing Committee Environmental Analysis EcologyAME10: Standing Committee Equity TransportationAME20: Standing Committee Women Gender TransportationAME30: Standing Committee Native American Transportation IssuesAME30: Standing Committee Transportation Developing CountriesAME50: Standing Committee Accessible Transportation MobilityAME60: Standing Committee Historic Archeological Preservation TransportationAME70: Standing Committee Transportation Public HealthAP025: Standing Committee Public Transportation Planning DevelopmentAP050: Standing Committee Bus Transit SystemsAP065: Standing Committee Urban Rail Transit SystemsAP090: Standing Committee Transit Data

heading: 3 Thesis format
text: advise students produce written thesis. minimum page word count. preference write succinctly possible fully describing project.thesis organized following chapters. chapters need names, serve functional purpose described .

heading: 3.1 Introduction
text: introduction clearly state research question, briefly explain question important, summarize answer question. also breifly summarize subsequent chapters.

heading: 3.2 Literature review
text: literature summarize prior research done scholars relates research question. purpose summary reader place research findings proper context.

heading: 3.3 Methods
text: methods chapter describe research approach enough detail interested motivated reader replicate work. details (example, survey instruments raw datasets) might need included reference appendix.

heading: 3.4 Results
text: results chapter summarize results analysis.

heading: 3.5 Discussion
text: discussion chapter relate results back literature ’ve summarized literature review chapter. strong parallels discussion chapter literature review chapter.

heading: 3.6 Conclusion
text: conclusion chapter summarize rest thesis strong parallels introduction. reader able understand overall argument support reading introduction conclusion.

heading: 4 Software tools
text: draft thesis RStudio using bookdown package (also used produce document). allow generate PDF document addition HTML-based ebook can include interactive elements. share template can use starting point.maintain code used produce thesis (document analysis) GitHub repository. offer feedback suggest edits using GitHub issues pull requests.

heading: 5 Advising meetings
text: meet thesis students advising group biweekly basis throughout Fall Spring semesters thesis year. Students come meetings prepared share progress.meet students individually needed.

heading: 6 Key dates
text: section describes tasks complete part thesis work approximate dates complete .

heading: 6.1.1 Reading to prepare you for writing
text: summer thesis year, read following books:Fix Academic Writing Trouble (Mewburn, Firth, Lehmann 2018). good introduction academic writing. Even good writer extensive academic writing experience, like read entire book ’ll common foundation build give feedback writing.Bookdown: authoring books technical documents R markdown (Xie 2016), reference use bookdown package. can read free . need read cover cover, want look ’re well prepared use reference.

heading: 6.1.2 Setting up a GitHub repository
text: summer, use template provide set GitHub repository thesis. Name repository something describes topic (.e. don’t call “Thesis”). Add repository collaborator.

heading: 6.1.3 Tasks specific to your research topic
text: two project-specific tasks complete summer thesis year:

heading: 6.1.3.1 Define your research question
text: Prior first meeting fall, develop specific question like answer research. time refine question thesis prep course. may find Chapter Three Craft Research (Booth et al. 2016) useful thnking makes useful research question.

heading: 6.1.3.2 Assemble some inital sources
text: Find least five journal articles relevant research question ’ve identified add book.bib file thesis GitHub repository.

heading: 6.2 Fall of your thesis year
text: course fall semester, develop thesis proposal part thesis prep course. Much material write thesis proposal can incorporated thesis. add material thesis draft GitHub repository go along.

heading: 6.2.1 Methods chapter
text: start Spring semester, write complete draft methods chapter thesis complete necessary IRB applications.

heading: 6.3 Spring of your thesis year
text: general, give least one week review chapter thesis.

heading: 6.3.1 Results chapter
text: Submit draft results chapter least one week Spring semester midterm review (ten weeks final thesis review).

heading: 6.3.2 Discussion chapter
text: Submit draft discussion chapter least eight weeks final thesis review.

heading: 6.3.3 Literature review chapter
text: Submit draft literatire review chapter least six weeks final thesis review.

heading: 6.3.4 Conclusion chapter
text: Submit conclusion chapter least four weeks final thesis review.

heading: 6.3.5 Introduction chapter
text: Submit introduction chapter least two weeks final thesis review.

heading: 6.3.6 Complete draft
text: Submit complete draft least one week final thesis review.
